intro: Rosa agrestis f. scaphusiensis, commonly known as the Scaphus hill rose, is a botanical variety of the common dog玫瑰. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and profuse blooming of small, fragrant pink flowers. The plant typically features dark green, serrated leaves and thorny stems, typical of many rose species. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in temperate climates.
